data.title: Out Now: Reinvigorated, The Black Crowes Return with ‘Happiness Bastards,’ Blues/Rock Icons’ First New Album in 15 Years (Listen/Buy)
data.meta_description: The Black Crowes' first album of new material in 15 years, 'Happiness Bastards' finds the blues/rock band revved-up & ready to rock.
data.text:
The Black Crowes Happiness Bastards (Photo: Ross Halfin)

The Black Crowes get right to it with “Bedside Manners,” the opening track on the blues/rock greats‘ new record, Happiness Bastards, their first set of original material in 15 years.

A snarling lead guitar riff gives way to singer Chris Robinson‘s unmistakable vocals as he delivers the line:

“Do not disturb” on the door

Pile of clothes on the floor

Bedside manners, profane grammar

I’ve seen this scene before

It packs all the swagger, the sweat, and the energy that has given the band — helmed as always by Robinson and brother Rich Robinson — its compelling edge for decades.

The rollicking “Wanting and Waiting” received its own music video a few weeks back — the Crowes’ first music video in 16 years:

Happiness Bastards has been in the works for a while, and received a boost of anticipation when the Black Crowes went out on the acclaimed tour commemorating 1990’s Shake Your Money Maker, the album that put the band on the map.

Click here to pick up Happiness Bastards on CD from our Rock Cellar Store

Click here to pick up Happiness Bastards on LP from our Rock Cellar Store

Said producer Jay Joyce of the creation of this new record, in a statement:

“These guys came to town like a freight train. Ready to lay it down, no bullshit. Old school real, live and raw. They brought the OG magic of their early albums along with some young punk spirit. I was honored to have captured it.”

Added the Robinson brothers:

“Happiness Bastards is our love letter to rock n’ roll. Rich and I are always writing and creating music; that has never stopped for us, and it is always where we find harmony together. This record represents that.” – Chris

“This album is a continuation of our story as a band. Our years of experience writing and making music and touring the world are represented in this record, and we were brilliantly guided by one of the best producers in the business, Jay Joyce. I am incredibly proud of what we put together.” – Rich

In full, Happiness Bastards presents the Black Crowes at their most visceral: loud, proud and boundlessly confident, it’s a powerful return to form sure to appeal to longtime fans.
